# getWhite(_:alpha:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the grayscale and alpha values of the color.

## Declaration

```swift
func getWhite(_ white: UnsafeMutablePointer<CGFloat>?, alpha: UnsafeMutablePointer<CGFloat>?)
```

## Parameters

- **white**: Upon return, contains the grayscale value of the color object.
- **alpha**: Upon return, contains the opacity value of the color object.

## Discussion

If `NULL` is passed in as an argument, the method doesn’t set that value. This method works only with objects representing colors in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/calibratedWhite], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCalibratedBlackColorSpace], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDeviceBlackColorSpace], or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSColorSpaceName/deviceWhite] color space. Sending it to other objects raises an exception.

## Related Documentation

- **NSColor**: An object that stores color data and sometimes opacity (alpha value).

## Retrieving component values from color objects

- **getCyan(_:magenta:yellow:black:alpha:)**: Returns the color object’s CMYK and opacity values.
- **getHue(_:saturation:brightness:alpha:)**: Returns the color object’s HSB component and opacity values in the respective arguments.
- **getRed(_:green:blue:alpha:)**: Returns the color object’s RGB component and opacity values in the respective arguments.
- **numberOfComponents**: The number of components in the color.
- **getComponents(_:)**: Returns the components of the color as an array.
